title: What is EQ?
content:
Equalization (EQ) is a fundamental tool in audio processing that allows you to adjust the balance between frequency components in an audio signal. Think of it like a sophisticated volume control that can target specific frequency ranges, allowing you to boost or cut particular elements of a sound.

EQ is essential for:
- Enhancing the clarity of specific instruments
- Removing unwanted frequencies
- Shaping the overall tonal balance of a mix
- Correcting problematic frequencies

title: High Pass & Low Pass Filters
content:
Two of the most common EQ techniques are High Pass and Low Pass filters:

High Pass Filter (HPF):
- Allows high frequencies to pass through
- Cuts off frequencies below the cutoff point
- Useful for removing rumble and low-end noise

Low Pass Filter (LPF):
- Allows low frequencies to pass through
- Cuts off frequencies above the cutoff point
- Useful for removing harsh high frequencies
